result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ishiah Julian Fleming

records.addlTxt: and returned

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). $500 previously posted to apply. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Defendant shall have a curfew "Curfew Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday from 7pm- 4am, unless there is a medical emergency with verified documentation provided to DCPTS. Curfew on Sunday from 7 pm to 7am.
- Defendant can only be released from jail between 8am - 4pm Monday - Friday.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Messiah F or Tamba A. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

02:37 PM Defendant appeared by video in custody with Attorney J. Steven House appeared in person.  Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
IN CUSTODY
Re: defense motion for bail modification
Statement by ADA Hess. Statement in support of motion by Atty House.
Court makes ruling and reduces cash bail to $500. Added condition of DCPTS and  curfew from 7pm-7am, unless there is a medical emergency with verified documentation provided to DCPTS. Defendant can only be released from the jail 8a-4pm Monday-Friday. All other conditions remain the same.
Bail/bond hearing on May 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
